conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_D and I’m very excited about the chance to join School_C. I’m looking for a rigorous environment and I’m ready to contribute strongly in class and in school activities. School_C is one of my top choices, and if admitted I will commit fully and make the most of the opportunity. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but School_B ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_C) with only 1 seat, so applying immediately is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_C is my 2nd choice and ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B, Student_C). That is still competitive but more attainable than School_B. I will apply to School_C now to try to secure a high-preference match early, emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_C. After reviewing our priorities and the limited availability this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your effort and wish you the very best in the process.
conversation.thought: Student_D is 3rd on School_C’s true priority list (behind Student_B and Student_C). We have quota 1 and it’s only round 1; Student_B ranks School_C 3rd (after A and B) and Student_C ranks School_C 2nd (after B), so there is a reasonable chance a higher-priority student may apply in upcoming rounds. Accepting Student_D now would lock our only seat and could prevent matching with Student_B or Student_C, which would be better for our objective. Therefore, reject now to preserve capacity for higher-priority applicants.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions Committee, I’m Student_C. School_B is my first-choice school because I’m especially interested in a rigorous environment and I believe I would contribute positively to the community. I would be honored to attend if offered the seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. I have relatively strong priority there (School_B ranks me 3rd), and applying immediately gives me the best chance before higher-priority students (Student_E, Student_B) potentially take the single seat. Since it is my first choice, I should apply rather than just talk.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for sharing why School_B is your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_B.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority order is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY from Student_C and Student_A. Between these two, Student_C is ranked higher than Student_A, so if I must choose now, accepting C dominates accepting A. However, my top choices Student_E and Student_B may still apply in later rounds: Student_E ranks School_B last, so is unlikely to apply; Student_B ranks School_B second (after School_A) and may apply if not accepted by School_A. There is some option value in waiting for Student_B, but rejecting Student_C now risks losing a high-ranked candidate who has stated School_B is first choice. Given the mechanism: an ACCEPT finalizes a match and removes us from future rounds, so accepting C trades off the chance at B. Considering Student_B likely targets School_A first and may get accepted there, the probability of upgrading to B is uncertain. Securing Student_C (my #3) is a strong, safe outcome versus potentially ending with a lower-ranked student or unfilled seat. Therefore, accept Student_C.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_A and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m especially excited about the academic environment and would commit to attending if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. However, School_B’s priority list ranks me last, while several other students (E, B, C, D) are above me and School_B is also their high choice, so competition is intense. Still, delaying only worsens my chances; an early, clear application is best. I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to School_B to maximize any discretionary advantage (even though priorities are fixed).

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_B. At this time, our available seat has already been filled, so we are unable to offer you admission.

We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best in the process.

[ACTION] [REJECT]
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (Remaining Quota: 0) with Student_C, and the rules require rejecting any new [APPLY] when quota is 0. Although Student_A is on our true priority list, we cannot accept without violating the constraint, so we must reject Student_A’s application this round.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—I'm Student_B. School_A is my first-choice school, and I’m very excited about the opportunity to join your community. I’m ready to commit if admitted and would be honored to take the available seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but I have relatively low priority there (4th). School_C ranks me 1st, so I can likely secure it later if needed. To maximize the chance of landing my highest true preference, I should apply to School_A immediately before it fills with a higher-priority student.

conversation.message:

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions

Since accepting Student_B now would fill the only seat and prevent matching with higher-priority Student_E who is already applying and willing to commit, the optimal strategy is to reject Student_B and preserve capacity for Student_E.

conversation.message: Dear School_A admissions, I’m Student_E and I would like to formally apply. Since capacities are 1, applying to School_C first is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. To maximize my final outcome on my true preference list, I should first secure a very safe high-ranked option. School_A is my 3rd choice and virtually guaranteed if I apply now, whereas School_B is my last choice. Therefore I will apply to School_A immediately to lock in a strong match.

Accepting Student_E immediately secures our top-choice match and avoids the risk of losing them to other schools where they are also highly prioritized (e.g., School_B and School_D rank Student_E #1).
